page.title: 06Landscape Beaches and Woods
page.content: Around Meadfoot Beach and Hesketh Crescent there are a lot of hotels and flats.At the south end of the beach there is a cliff and at the top there is Daddyhole Plain which is a famous lookout.Across the beach by the parking spaces there is a spring of mineral water.At the other end of the beach there is Ilsham Valley with playing field and puplic woods.Bishops Walk is a coast walk around Black Head which was The Bishop of Exeter's favourite stroll when The Palace Hotel was The Bishop's Palace.Anstey's Cove is a rocky beach and very uncomfortable to sunbathe on.A bit further on is Redgate which is a lot sandier and more comfortable with steps going up to Walls Hill.Other beaches are at Oddicombe and Babbacombe.
